meta_title.text: Fuel Barometer - Petrol, diesel, hybrid and electric car trends

meta_description.text: The Confused.com Fuel Barometer looks at the changing trends of electric and hybrid cars, public perception, and the legislation that sparks conversation.

intro_content.text:
The year 2040 will see the end of new petrol and diesel cars on our roads as we embrace electric and hybrid vehicles.

The barometer uses Google Trends, car registration data and a nationally-representative survey to see how our attitudes towards alternative fuel is changing.

Please vote on the poll below and scroll down to explore the data.

poll_question.text: What type of car do you currently drive?

graph_title.settingDescription: Title for area graphs are displayed in

graph_intro_survey.text: This chart shows the percentage of people who answered for each fuel type when asked “What car would you consider as your next purchase?” Source: Confused.com data.

graph_intro_registrations.settingDescription: Introductory text for car registration data
graph_intro_registrations.text: This chart shows the percentage share of new vehicle registrations, broken down by fuel type. Source: SMMT

graph_intro_trends.settingDescription: Introductory text for Google Trends data
graph_intro_trends.text: This chart shows the popularity of conversation on each fuel type in Google search. Source: Google Trends.

methodology_content.text:
The Confused.com Fuel Barometer uses three different data points - nationally-representative surveys of UK motorists, SMMT registrations and Google Trends. All data points are broken down by vehicle type: diesel, petrol, hybrid and electric.

These figures look back at the past 12 months. Relevant government and industry announcements are added to the charts for context and to explain shifts in trends for each fuel type.

social_og_description.text: In 2040, the sale of new petrol and diesel cars will be abolished in favour of electric cars. But are we any closer to fully embracing alternative fuel vehicles?

social_twitter_text.text: Will we fully embrace electric cars before 2040? The Confused.com Fuel Barometer looks to answer this question %url%
